1.text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was {what} God {was}.

2.text: This one was in the beginning with God.

3.text: All things came into being through him, and without him, nothing came into being that has come into being.

4.text: In him was life, life that was the light of mankind.

5.text: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not overcome it.

6.text: There came a man, sent from God, whose name was John.

7.text: John came as a witness, to bear witness to the light, so that all might believe through him.

8.text: He was not the light, but [he was sent] to bear witness to the light.

9.text: The true light which enlightens everyone was coming into the world.

10.text: He was in the world, and the world had come into existence through him, and the world did not recognize him.

11.text: He came to his own [people], and those who were his own did not receive him.

12.text: But as many as received him, to them he gave the ability to become God’s children, to those who believe in his Name.

13.text: They were born not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.

14.text: The Word became flesh and made his dwelling among us. We beheld his glory, glory as a Father’s uniquely-begotten son, full of grace and truth.

15.text: John testified about him; he cried out, saying, “This was the one of whom I said, ‘He who comes after me ranks ahead of me because he was before me.’”

16.text: And from his fullness, we have all received grace upon grace.

17.text: For the law was given through Moses, [but] grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.

18.text: No one has seen God at any time. The uniquely-begotten Son who is in the bosom of the Father, he has explained him.

19.text: This is John’s testimony, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”

20.text: He admitted and did not deny [it], [plainly] admitting, “I am not the Christ!”

21.text: They asked him, “What then? Are you Elias (Elijah)?” He said, “I am not!” “Are you the prophet?” He answered, “No.”

22.text: Therefore, they asked him, “Who are you? Give us an answer to take back to those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”

23.text: John said, “I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness, ‘Make straight the way of the Lord,’ as Isaias (Isaiah) the prophet said.”

24.text: Those who had been sent were from the Pharisees.

25.text: They asked him, “Why then do you baptize, if you are not the Christ, nor Elias (Elijah), nor the prophet?”

26.text: John answered them, “I baptize in water, but among you stands one whom you do not know.

27.text: He is the one who comes after me, who is ranked before me, whose sandal strap I am not worthy to untie.”

28.text: These things took place in Bethany beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.

29.text: The next day, John saw Jesus coming to him and said, “Behold, the Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world!

30.text: This is the one of whom I said, ‘After me comes a man who is ranked before me, because he was before me.’

31.text: I did not know him, but for this reason I came baptizing in water: so that he would be revealed to Israel.”

32.text: John bore witness, saying, “I saw the Spirit descending as a dove out of heaven and remain on him.

33.text: I did not know him, but the one who sent me to baptize in water said to me, ‘Upon whom you will see the Spirit descending and remaining, this is he who baptizes in the Holy Spirit.’

34.text: Moreover, I myself have seen and testified that this is the Son of God.”

35.text: Again, the next day, John was standing with two of his disciples.

36.text: He looked at Jesus as he was walking by and said, “Behold, the Lamb of God!”

37.text: The two disciples heard him speak, and they began to follow Jesus.

38.text: Turning and seeing them following, Jesus asked them, “What are you looking for?” They said to him, “Rabbi” (which translated means Teacher), “where are you staying?”

39.text: Jesus said to them, “Come and see!” They came therefore and saw where he was staying, and they remained with him that day. (It was about the tenth hour).

40.text: One of the two who heard John and who began to follow Jesus was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.

41.text: He first found his own brother, Simon and said to him, “We have found the Messiah!” (which translated means Christ).

42.text: And Andrew brought him to Jesus who looked at him, and said, “You are Simon the son of Jonah. You shall be called Kephas” (which translated means Peter).

43.text: On the next day, being determined to go out into Galilee, Jesus met Philip and said to him, “Follow me!”

44.text: Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.

45.text: Philip found Nathaniel and said to him, “We have found the one of whom Moses in the law and the prophets, wrote: Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph!”

46.text: Nathanael asked him, “Can anything good come out of Nazareth?” Philip replied, “Come and see!”

47.text: As Jesus saw Nathaniel coming to him, he said about him, “Behold, an Israelite indeed, in whom there is no deceit!”

48.text: Nathanael asked Jesus, “How do you know me?” Jesus answered and said to him, “Before Philip called you, when you were under the fig tree, I saw you.”

49.text: Nathanael replied, “Rabbi, you are the Son of God! You are King of Israel!”

50.text: Jesus said to him, “Because I told you, ‘I saw you underneath the fig tree,’ do you believe? You will see greater things than these!”

51.text: He said to Philip, “Amen, amen, I tell you; hereafter, you will see heaven opened, and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of Man.”
